_comment: ArcaScience Webflow CMS — Sample data for design and testing. Import via Webflow CMS API or enter manually in the Designer.

therapeutic-areas.name: Oncology
therapeutic-areas.description: Comprehensive benefit-risk analysis for oncology drugs, covering complex safety profiles, biomarker-driven therapies, and accelerated approval pathways.

therapeutic-areas.name: Immunology
therapeutic-areas.description: Specialized BRA capabilities for immunomodulatory and biologic therapies, including long-term safety monitoring and immunogenicity assessment.

therapeutic-areas.name: Rare Diseases
therapeutic-areas.description: Tailored analysis for orphan drugs and rare disease therapies, addressing small population challenges and natural history data integration.

therapeutic-areas.name: Dermatology
therapeutic-areas.description: Benefit-risk assessment for dermatologic therapies including biologics, small molecules, and topical treatments with patient-reported outcome integration.

therapeutic-areas.name: Neurology
therapeutic-areas.description: Advanced BRA for neurologic therapies addressing complex CNS safety profiles, cognitive outcomes, and long-term treatment effects.

therapeutic-areas.name: Cardiology
therapeutic-areas.description: Cardiovascular safety analysis including MACE endpoint modeling, QT prolongation assessment, and post-marketing CV surveillance.

therapeutic-areas.name: Respiratory
therapeutic-areas.description: BRA support for respiratory therapies including inhaled biologics, COPD treatments, and asthma biologic safety monitoring.

therapeutic-areas.name: Infectious Disease
therapeutic-areas.description: Rapid benefit-risk analysis for anti-infective therapies, vaccines, and pandemic-response treatments with real-time safety signal detection.

therapeutic-areas.name: Gastroenterology
therapeutic-areas.description: Specialized analysis for GI therapies including IBD biologics, liver disease treatments, and GI safety signal characterization.

therapeutic-areas.name: Endocrinology
therapeutic-areas.description: BRA for metabolic and endocrine therapies including diabetes treatments, thyroid medications, and hormone therapies with cardiovascular risk integration.

therapeutic-areas.name: Hematology
therapeutic-areas.description: Benefit-risk assessment for hematologic therapies including cell and gene therapies, anticoagulants, and rare blood disorder treatments.

therapeutic-areas.name: Pediatrics
therapeutic-areas.description: Age-appropriate BRA for pediatric drug development, incorporating growth and development safety endpoints and extrapolation modeling.

platform-modules.name: Data Intelligence
platform-modules.short-description: Ingest, harmonize, and enrich 100B+ data points from clinical trials, post-market databases, and real-world evidence sources.

platform-modules.name: Decision Intelligence
platform-modules.short-description: Apply BRAT frameworks, MCDA models, and AI-powered analytics to quantify benefit-risk profiles with regulatory-grade rigor.

platform-modules.name: Automated Outputs
platform-modules.short-description: Generate submission-ready documents including PSURs, RMPs, CTD Module 2.5, and HEOR reports with full audit trails.

case-studies.title: Dermatology BRA Acceleration
case-studies.challenge: Sanofi's pharmacovigilance team needed to accelerate periodic safety update report generation for a key dermatology biologic while maintaining regulatory rigor. Manual processes required 12+ weeks per cycle and involved reconciling data from 47 countries.
case-studies.approach: ArcaScience deployed the full platform—Data Intelligence for multi-source harmonization, Decision Intelligence for automated BRAT analysis, and Automated Outputs for PSUR draft generation—integrated with Sanofi's existing safety database.
case-studies.outcome: 60% reduction in PSUR cycle time (from 12 weeks to under 5 weeks), with improved signal detection sensitivity and full EMA acceptance of AI-assisted submissions.
case-studies.testimonial-quote: ArcaScience transformed our periodic reporting from a quarterly burden into a strategic advantage. The platform's ability to harmonize global safety data and generate regulatory-ready outputs has fundamentally changed how we approach benefit-risk assessment.

case-studies.title: Oncology Signal Detection Enhancement
case-studies.challenge: AstraZeneca required faster, more sensitive signal detection across their oncology portfolio, where complex multi-drug regimens and novel mechanisms created a high volume of safety signals requiring prioritization.
case-studies.approach: Deployed ArcaScience's AI-powered signal detection with disproportionality analysis (PRR, ROR, BCPNN) and machine learning classifiers trained on oncology-specific adverse event patterns.
case-studies.outcome: 3x improvement in signal detection speed, with 40% reduction in false-positive rates, enabling the safety team to focus on clinically meaningful signals.
case-studies.testimonial-quote: The precision of ArcaScience's signal detection has given our oncology safety team confidence to act faster on emerging risks while spending less time chasing noise.

case-studies.title: Rare Disease Regulatory Submission
case-studies.challenge: Takeda faced the unique challenge of building a comprehensive benefit-risk case for an orphan drug with limited clinical data, requiring integration of natural history studies, real-world evidence, and expert elicitation.
case-studies.approach: ArcaScience's Decision Intelligence module applied structured expert elicitation alongside quantitative BRA frameworks, integrating sparse clinical data with external evidence to build a robust submission-ready benefit-risk assessment.
case-studies.outcome: Successful FDA and EMA submission with first-cycle approval. The benefit-risk framework was cited by reviewers as exemplary for rare disease applications.
case-studies.testimonial-quote: For rare diseases, every data point matters. ArcaScience helped us weave together disparate evidence sources into a compelling benefit-risk narrative that resonated with regulators on both sides of the Atlantic.

team-members.name: Romain Clement
team-members.title: Co-Founder & CEO
team-members.short-bio: Founded ArcaScience after personal experience with brain cancer treatment highlighted the need for better drug safety decision-making.

team-members.name: Dr. Claire Dupont
team-members.title: Co-Founder & Chief Science Officer
team-members.short-bio: 15+ years in pharmacoepidemiology and regulatory science. Former EMA Committee member.

team-members.name: Dr. Marc Tessier
team-members.title: Chief Technology Officer
team-members.short-bio: Previously led AI/ML engineering at a top-10 pharma company. Expert in NLP for biomedical text mining.

team-members.name: Sarah Mitchell
team-members.title: Chief Operating Officer
team-members.short-bio: 20 years in pharma operations and SaaS scaling. Previously COO at a leading clinical trial technology company.
